Filled by Arlas: This field will be automatically filled by Arlas
Field set by unit collection in look and: This field is automatically filled in with the collection unit entered in look and feel. If you want to change this value, go to the look and feel tab.
Choose main collection: Choose the main collection of the dashboard.
Name: Name
Data tables are out of analytics: Data tables are now to be declared in the dedicated menu (on the left), outside this analytics board
Title: Title
Transformation:
Apply a calculation in javascript (e.g : result*1000).
'result' being the javascript variable to transform
At least one column is required: At least one column is required
At least one field is required within a: At least one field is required within a detail
Add a field tooltip: Add a field of the item to this section
Add a detail tooltip: Add a section in the details of the items
Quicklook filter field: Field to restrict for which items this quicklook is available (optional)
Quicklook filter values: Values of the selected field to filter for (optional)
Add a quicklook tooltip: Add a quicklook to explore the image
At least one group is required within a: At least one group is required within a tab
Choose of the following widgets: Choose one of the following widgets
At least one tab is required: At least one tab is required
The widget has invalid inputs. Edit to f: The widget has invalid inputs. Edit to fix them
External Node schema description: Link to the Json schema that validates the External Node
This dashboard doesn't contain an import: This dashboard doesn't contain an importable layer
No collection with geometries is availab: No collection with geometries is available in the server
layer description: A layer helps you analyse a geographical information in your collection. You can customise what geographical data to display and how to render it.
visualisation set description: A visualisation set is a space where to organise layers that have to be displayed/hidden together.
This layer is not assigned to a visualis: * This layer is not assigned to a visualisation set, it will not be visible on the map
metric filter: Apply an ARLAS filter to the metric (optional)
Insert field to URL tooltip: Click here to insert a field value.
Unable to access the server. Please, ver: Unable to reach the server. Please, verify the url.
Do you really want to exit without savin: Do you really want to exit without saving?
Do you really want to delete the widget?: Do you really want to delete the widget?
Do you really want to delete this group?: Do you really want to delete this group?
Do you really want to delete this tab?: Do you really want to delete this tab?
maximum number of bucket is: ⚠ The maximum number of buckets is:
Donut collection description: Choose the data collection for this donut
donut field description:
• Number of nodes to display on the ring. The rest of the nodes are aggregated under a node 'Other'. 
 • Field used to build the donut. By choosing several fields, several levels of rings are created.
donut opacity description: Sets the opacity of the other nodes in the donut when hovering over or selecting a node
Donut multiselectable description: Allows you to apply a filter by selecting several nodes in the donut
Donut manage colors description: Sets the colours associated with the values present in the donut's nodes
export csv donut description: If activated, a button will be displayed near the donut to export its content as CSV file
histogram title: Choose a title for this histogram
Histogram collection description: Choose the data collection for this histogram
Use UTC time Zone to display date?: Displaying date in UTC time Zone
Use UTC time Zone to display date descri: Whether displaying date in UTC time Zone or in the local time zone of the browser.
histogram multiselectable description: Allows the selection of several disjoint intervals on the histogram
Chart type description: Choose the graphical rendering of the histogram buckets
Date format description:
Choose the date format on the x-Axis: 
 • English: Month, dat, year 
 • French: day, month, year
export csv histogram description: If activated, a button will be displayed near the histogram to export its content as CSV file
metric sort on description:
Choice of sorting type: 
 • Number of elements: the powerbars are sorted according to the number of elements per bucket. 
 • Label: the powerbars are sorted according to the label of the bucket (value of the aggregation field) 
 • Metric: if a metric is chosen, the powerbars are sorted according to the value of this metric.
metric sort order description: Choice of sorting direction: ascending or descending.
Metric collection description: Choose the data collection for this metric
metric function description: Function (javascript) allowing to specify the calculation of the metric. By default 'm[0]', but can become '100*m[0]+m[1]'. The index corresponds to the different metrics defined previously
Short value description: Displays the result of the metric in a compressed format (e.g: 1000->1k)
Metric value precision description: Number of digits after decimal point. Put 0 if you want to round the metric value to an integer.
Before value description: Explanatory text preceding the metric (ex: Number of objects)
After value description: Text succeeding the metric value, often a unit
Powerbar collection description: Choose the data collection for this powerbars
powerbar size description: Number of values displayed in the Powerbar
powerbar unit description: Unit of the calculated metric. It will be displayed on the tooltip when hovering a bar.
Powerbar operator description:
Operation applied at powerbar selection. 
 • Include : The powerbar fetches the data including the selected terms. 
 • Exclude : The powerbar fetches the data excluding the selected terms.
Method to retrive powerbar color descrip:
Choose one of the method of associating the color of the powerbar: 
 • None 
 • Manual: Manually adjust the color of each value of the chosen field. Unconfigured values ​​will have an automatically generated color 
 • Provided: The color of the powerbar is provided by a field
Provided source powerbar field descripti: • The chosen field values should be hexadecimal colours (e.g #000000) that will be attributed to the powerbar
Powerbar manually associate colors descr: Allows you to manually define the colours associated with each value represented in the Powerbar
A field is required to manage colors: A field must be filled in to adjust the associated colours
powerbar display filter description: Allows to search textually for values of the field represented in the powerbar
Scrollable powerbar description: Allows to fix powerbar size and scroll into it
export csv powerbars description: If activated, a button will be displayed near the powerbars to export its content as CSV file
operator powerbars description: If enabled, the user can change the chosen operation (Include/Exclude) on the fly
Resultlist collection description: Choose the data collection for this data table
Search size description: Number of results available by default in the data table (ability to scroll through the results to see more)
Display filters description: Allows you to perform a textual search on the values in each table column
Background style of cells Description:
• If the type is 'Filled', the entire cell is coloured. 
 • If the type is 'Outlined', only the outline is colored.
List default mode description: Choose if grid view is enabled by default
Use http thumbnails description: If the thumbnails are protected, allows to add an Authorization header to grant access to them.
Use http quicklooks description: If the quicklooks are protected, allows to add an Authorization header to grant access to them.
Tile label description: Field used as title for a tile
Transformation title description: Apply a transformation to the title in javascript. e.g : (result  + '').toLowerCase(). 'result' being the javascript variable to transform
Tooltip field description: Field used as tooltip for a tile
Transformation tooltip description: Apply a transformation to the tooltip in javascript. e.g : (result  + '').toLowerCase(). 'result' being the javascript variable to transform
Color identifier description: Field which value is transformed to a color and used as color for the icon
Thumbnail url description:
Url of the thumbnail. 
 You can use templating with the '{}' characters, by putting a field name in it. 
 Press the 'Insert field to Url' button and find all the fields in the data collection that you can insert into the Url. 
 For example: http://my_thumbnail_service/{id} .
Visualisation url service description:
Url of the data visualization service to display the data on the map. 
  You can use templating using the characters '{}', putting a field name and replacing the '.' with '_' for nested objects. 
  For example: http: // my_visu_service / {collection_name} / {id}. 
  If the url is the first element of an 'urls' array you can access it as follows: {urls_0}
Download url service description:
Url of the download service to acess the data. 
  You can use templating using the characters '{}', putting a field name and replacing the '.' with '_' for nested objects. 
  For example: http: // my_visu_service / {collection_name} / {id}. 
  If the url is the first element of an 'urls' array you can access it as follows: {urls_0}
Swimlane collection description: Choose the data collection for this multiline chart
Term field description: Choose a field to cut the diagram into several lines. Each line has its own histogram
Term size description: Allows to choose the number of lines represented in the chart
Swimlane mode description:
Sets the type of histogram display. Each histogram bucket contains an aggregate value
• Fixed height: The buckets are represented by bars and only the color varies according to the value of the bucket. 
• Variable height: The color and height of the bars vary according to the value of the bucket. 
• Circle: Each bucket is represented by a circle whose radius and color varies according to the value of the bucket
Swimlane representation description:
Aggregated values are normalised to be represented in size and colour on the histograms: 
 • Normalise globally: the values of all buckets in all histograms are normalised taking into account the global minimum and maximum. This makes it possible to compare all the buckets with each other. 
 • Normalise by column: For each column, the values of the buckets are normalised taking into account the minimum and maximum of the column. This allows to analyse the values between them, column by column. The columns are therefore independent
Palette colors description: Colour palette used to represent histogram values
Is zero representative description: Defines whether the zero value is to be represented or considered as an absence of data
Drag and drop description: Allows widgets to be moved by dragging them
Zoom to data description: Displays a button to adjust the zoom level of the map to the available data extent
Display indicators description: Displays a red dot to signify the presence of a filter on a widget in the application
Display spinners description: Allows to display a spinner while the widgets are reloading on the selected data
collection unit description:
Give a unit to each configured collection. Each unit will appear next to the corresponding Count in the exploration app. 
 
 'Hidden collections' are configured collections (timeline | analytics | map layers) but whose count will not appear on the exploration application
Do you really want to delete the filter?: Do you really want to delete the filter?
Do you really want to delete the layer?: Do you really want to delete the layer?
Preview saved temporarily. Save the dash: Preview saved temporarily. Save the dashboard to validate the preview too.
Do you really want to delete the visuali: Do you really want to delete the visualisation set?
Initial zoom description: Zoom level of the map when the app is first loaded
Init center latitude description: Latitude of the map's centre when the app is first loaded
Init center longitude description: Longitude of the map centre when the app is first loaded
Allow map extend description: If allowed, the map extent is updated in the URL after each map move-end
Display scale description: Display a dynamic scale on the map
Display coordinates description: Display the current coordinates of the pointer.
geofilters description: Choose, for each collection, the default queried geographical field and the geographical operator when drawing a bbox or a polygon on the map.
list of geofilters: The collections list is automatically filled from the configured map 'Layers'
no geofilter: • The collections list is empty as long as no 'Layer' is configured
MargePanForLoad description: A marge pan around the screen where geographical data will be loaded.
MargePanForTest description: A marge pan around the screen that is included in the count of features number on the map
Name of the layer. Only used for visuali: Name of the layer. Only used for visualization.
Type of representation of the data layer 
 • Geometric features: display all the real geographical entities composing your data 
 • Network analytics: when the geographical entity corresponds to an event emitted by an element: measurements emitted by a pollution station or bus passages through a stop, Networks analytics can aggregate these events by emitter by calculating a metric
 • Cluster: aggregate all the geographical entities according to a geographical grid
Layer collection description: Choose the data collection of this layer
The layer can be put in one or several v: The layer can be put in one or several visualisation sets
Network Analytics Fetching Precision is: Data is fetched according to a X.Y.Z grid where level Z is
Therefore; minimum zoom level of the lay: Therefore; minimum zoom level of the layer should be three levels greater. It should be greather than
Maximum zoom level of the layer should b: Maximum zoom level of the layer should be greater than
Filter field description: Filter elements on the layer using this field.
filter operation description: Operation applied to the values of the chosen field.
filter in-values description:
List of chosen field's possible values. 
 Elements of the layer having the chosen field value IN/NOT IN this list will be displayed on the map.
filter equal description: Elements of the layer having the chosen field value EQUAL/NOT EQUAL to this value will be displayed on the map.
Minimum range filter description: Set the minimum value of the range
Maximum range filter description: Set the maximum value of the range
overlap description: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn labels
opacity description: Setting the layer's opacity [0: fully transparent -> 1: fully opaque]
property weight description: Weight associated with each point on the heatmap to calculate the density
property intensity description: Additional weight added to all points to adjust the intensity of the heatmap appearance globally
property label size description: Setting the labels size in pixels:
property label rotation description:
Setting the labels rotation angle (degrees): 
 • Orientation is clockwise. 0 does point to the east. 0° → ; 45° ↘
label placement description:
• Placement of the label relative to its geometry. 
 - point: The label is placed at the point where the geometry is located. 
 - line : The label is placed along the line of the geometry. 
 - line-center : The label is placed at the center of the line of the geometry.
label alignment description:
• Align the label to the position of the point. 
 left: The label is displayed to the left of the point. 
 - center : the center of the label coincides with the point. 
 - right : the label is displayed to the right of the point.
label offset dx description:
Translates the labels according to x-axis (pixels): 
 • Positive values indicate right offset. 
 • Negative values indicate left offset.
label offset dy description:
Translates the labels according to y-axis (pixels): 
 • Positive values indicate down offset. 
 • Negative values indicate up offset.
property label halo color description: Colour of the halo that is displayed around the label
property label halo width description: Setting the halo width in pixels:
property label halo blur description: Setting the halo blur in pixels:
Whether the layer is visible or not: Whether the layer is visible or not
Network Fetching Level description: Network Analytics data are fetched on the map according to a X.Y.Z grid. Choose the zoom level Z of the X.Y.Z tiles.
zoom min description: Minimum zoom level to display the layer
zoom max description: Maximum zoom level to display the layer
Map filters description: List of filters applied to the layer
Render mode description:
Geometric Features mode's data can be fetched with two manners: 
 • Scrollable Features: Features on the map are synchronised with rows on the list. Scrolling in the list will trigger loading new rows and new features on the map simultaneously. 
 • All Features: All Features on the current extent of the map will be fetched, as long as the number of features is less than or equal the 'Features max' below.
Maximum number of features to display th: Maximum number of features to display this layer
Order field feature metric description:
(Optional) Sort data of aggregation by one or many fields. The first element of the resulted sort is the one rendered in the geometry.
 If empty, we order by descending collection date.
Geometry ID description: Choose the identifier field of the network elements
Choose the geo aggregation field: Choose the geo-field used to aggregate data to a geographic grid
Geographic type grid description:
There are two kind of grid to aggregate data. 
 • Tile Grid: grid made up of squares of 256 pixels on a side conforming to the EPSG 3857 projection. 
 • Geohash grid: grid made up of rectangles according to the geohash system specification.
cluster geometry type description:
You can display on the cell one of these geometries: 
 • Aggregated geometry: a geometry representing all the data in the cell (data's centroid, data's extent, ...) 
 • Raw geometry: the geometry of one raw element in the cell.
Displayed geometry: Displayed geometry on each grid's cell
Aggregated geometry type description:
Choose which aggregated geometry to display:
 • Cell's center: the point at the center of the cell 
 • Cell's extent: the rectangle representing the cell 
 • Data's centroid: Weighted point from all geographic entities inside the cell 
 • Data's extent: the smallest rectangle containing all the geographic entities inside the cell
geometry field description: Each cell's geometry will be represented by the geometry of one raw element.
Order field description: Sort data inside the cell by one or many fields. The first element of the resulted sort is the one rendered in the cell.
Minimum number of features to display th: Minimum number of features to display this layer
When loading the map, this visualisation: When the map is loaded, the layers put in this Visualisation set will be displayed/hidden
Do you really want to delete this list?: Do you really want to delete this list?
Placeholder descritpion: Text displayed in search bar as a placeholder
Search field description: Field used for the search bar
Autocomplete field description: Field used to autocomplete your searched words
Autocomplete size description: Number of proposed terms by the autocompletion
maxAgeCache description: Cache duration (seconds) of ARLAS server's GET requests
Share module description:
If activated, a 'Share' button will be displayed on the left menu of ARLAS Exploration. 
 • This button allows you to choose a layer on the map and export as Geojson file or a zipped shapefile.
Download module description:
If activated, a 'Download' button will be displayed on the left menu of ARLAS Exploration. 
 • This button allows you to download the data as a CSV or JSON file, by executing a docker cammand.
Tagger module description:
If activated, a 'Tag' button will be displayed on the left menu of ARLAS Exploration. 
 • This button allows you to give selected data in ARLAS Exploration a tag. It uses ARLAS-tagger.
Timeline collection description: Choose the main data collection for the timeline
Additional collections description: Choose additional collections to display in timeline
Chart title description: Denomination of the elements handled in ARLAS (ex: Vessel positions)
Is timeline multi-selectable description: Allows the selection of several disjoint time intervals
Timeline percent of selection extent des: A share (%) of the selected time range is available on each side of the detailed timeline in order to widen the selection
Color fixed description: Choose a unique colour applied to all geometries
provided field agg description: • The label text is fetched from the chosen field value. The chosen field corresponds to a Hit in the cell fetched with the sort below.
Order provided field description: • Sort the Hit in the cell according to 1 or several fields
short format description: • Display numeric values in short format. E.g: 1.5k , 3M, ...
label metric field description: • Field on which the metric is calculated
Provided source field description: • The chosen field values should be hexadecimal colours (e.g #000000) that will be attributed to the geometries
label field description: • (Optional) Associate a label to the colour (legend)
Generated source field description: • Geometries colours are automatically generated from the chosen field's values
Manual source field description: • Set manually the geometry colour using the chosen field values.
Normalize by key description: • Normalise the chosen interpolation field values between 0 and 1. Normalisation is automatically managed by ARLAS
Normalize key field description: • For each key field value, normalise the chosen interpolation field values between 0 and 1
Cannot fetch current config: Cannot fetch the current dashboards' information
Log in to access saved dashboards: Log in to access saved dashboards
histogram aggregation field description: Choose a temporal or numerical field for the x-axis
swimlane aggregation field description: Choose a temporal or numerical field for the x-axis
temporal aggregation field description: Choose the temporal field used to represent the timeline.
Choose histogram aggregation Mode:
Configure the histogram's buckets by either choosing a: 
 • Preferred number of buckets: ARLAS approximates this number as close as possible. 
 • Preferred bucket's interval: This interval is assigned to the bucket as long as it doesn't generate more than the maximum number of buckets. Otherwise, ARLAS approximates this value as close as possible.
Choose swimlane aggregation Mode:
There are two ways of configuring the histogram's buckets size. 
 • Number of buckets: you choose how many buckets to have on the histogram. 
 • Bucket's size: you decide how large a bucket's interval should be.
Choose temporal aggregation Mode:
Configure the timelines's buckets by either choosing a: 
 • Preferred number of buckets: ARLAS approximates this number as close as possible. 
 • Preferred bucket's interval: This interval is assigned to the bucket as long as it doesn't generate more than the maximum number of buckets. Otherwise, ARLAS approximates this value as close as possible.
histogram metric collect function Descri: Choose the metric represented on the y-Axis
powerbars metric collect function Descri: Choose the metric represented on each bar of the powerbar
swimlane metric collect function Descrip: Choose the metric represented by a coloured bucket on each lane
histogram metric collect field Descripti: The field on which the metric is calculated
powerbars metric collect field Descripti: The field on which the metric is calculated on each bar
swimlane metric collect field Descriptio: The field on which the metric is calculated
Geographical operator description: The default geographical operator when drawing a bbox or a polygon.
Geographical field description: The queried geometry field when drawing a bbox or a polygon
App unit description: Unit displayed after the global count of explored elements
Label: Label
Use color service description: Allows you to colour certain columns of the table. The cell is coloured according to the value of the field.
property color cluster description:
Colour Adjustment 

• If the aggregated geometries are represented by Circle, Polygon or Label, the colour is fixed or interpolated according to the number of elements or the metric of a field in each cell. 
 • If the aggregated geometries are represented by Heatmap, the colour reflects the density of the points on the map
property radius cluster description:
Setting the radius of the circles 
 • If the aggregated geometries are represented by circles, this radius defines the size of each circle 
 • If the aggregated geometries are represented by a heat map, the radius defines the geographical spread around each point to calculate the density
Interpolated weight description: • The weight associated to each point in the heatmap is linearly interpolated with the Hits count or a metric
feature-metric geometry field descriptio: Choose the geometry field of the network elements
feature geometry field description: Choose the geometry field of the features
Swimlane name description: Name associated to the multiline chart
geometry feature shape description: Shape of the displayed geometry (Polygon, Line, Circle, Label)
geometry feature-metric shape descriptio: Shape of the displayed geometry (Polygon, Line, Circle, Label)
geometry cluster shape description:
Shape of the displayed geometry (Polygon, Circle, Heatmap, Label). 

 If the aggregated geometry is represented with a point, it is recommended to display it as:
 • Circle.
• Heatmap.
• Label.

If the aggregated geometry is represented with a cell, it is recommended to display it as :
• Polygon.
• Label
You are no more connected or your sessio: You are no more connected or your session has expired. Would you like to log in again?
You are not authorized to access at this: You are not authorized to access at this ressource.
Warning, changing this field's value wil: Warning, changing this field's value will reset some other fields
Interpolated source field description co: • The geometries colours are interpolated with the chosen interpolation field values
Interpolated source field description wi: • The lines widths are interpolated with the chosen interpolation field values
Interpolated source field description ra: • The circles radiuses are interpolated with the chosen interpolation field values
Interpolated source field description st: • The stroke width is interpolated with the chosen interpolation field values
• The stroke opacity is interpolated with the chosen interpolation field values
• The stroke colour is interpolated with the chosen interpolation field values
Interpolated radius description: Radius values are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values
Interpolated width description: Width values are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values
Interpolated opacity description: Opacity values are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values
Interpolated strokeColor description: Stroke colors are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values
Interpolated strokeWidth description: Stroke width values are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values
Interpolated strokeOpacity description: Stroke opacity values are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values
Another dashboad already exists with the: Another dashboad already exists with the same name, please choose another one
Interpolated labelSize description: • Labels sizes are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values.
Interpolated source field description la: • Labels sizes are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values.
Slider fixed value description labelSize: • All labels have the same size
Metric or count labelRotation descriptio: • The label orientation is the calculcated count/metric value
Slider fixed value description labelRota: • All labels have the same orientation
Interpolated labelRotation description: • Labels orientations are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values.
Interpolated source field description la: • Labels orientation are linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values.
Interpolated labelHaloColor description: • The halo color is linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values.
Slider fixed value description labelHalo: • All labels have the same halo width.
Interpolated labelHaloWidth description: • Labels halo width is linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values.
Slider fixed value description labelHalo: • All labels have the same halo blur.
Interpolated labelHaloBlur description: • Labels halo blur is linearaly interpolated with the Hits count or a field's metric values.
Input fixed value description labelConte:
All the labels have the same text. 
 • Printable Unicode characters can be used : →, ⅔, ... 
 • List of unicode characters : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unicode_characters#Arrows
Metric or count labelContent description: • Label's value is either the Hits count or a metric on a field
label content description description pr: • The label displayed on the map is provided by the chosen field's value.
property label rotation description prov: • The label rotation value is provided by the chosen field
compute metric description:
• Compute a metric on the chosen field. 
 • Optionally, apply an ARLAS filter on the computed metric.
